com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes

Interface Remote

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JiveRemote, NoopRemote

    public interface Remote
    Defines an interface for interacting with a remote document source. See JiveRemote for an example.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configure(Config.RemoteConfig config) 
      void create(Context context, Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
      Called to create a new document on the remote.
      void delete(Context context, Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
      Called to delete an existing document on the remote.
      void update(Context context, Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
      Called to update an existing document on the remote.
      default void validateDocumentMetadata(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
      Called for each document to validate that all metadata required by the remote exists.
      default void validateRemoteConfig()
      Called after instantiating the Remote to validate the configuration has all information required to use the remote.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        void configure(Config.RemoteConfig config)

      • validateRemoteConfig

        default void validateRemoteConfig()
                           throws IllegalStateException
        Called after instantiating the Remote to validate the configuration has all information required to use the remote.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The remote configuration is invalid.

      • validateDocumentMetadata

        default void validateDocumentMetadata(Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
                               throws IllegalStateException
        Called for each document to validate that all metadata required by the remote exists.
        Parameters:
        metadata - document to validate
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - The document metadata is invalid.

      • create

        void create(Context context,
            Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
     throws IOException
        Called to create a new document on the remote.

        If the remote doesnt support native markdown, the metadata should contain link to converted html file in Context.convertedPaths by the time this method is called. The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.remoteUri
        • Config.DocumentMetadata.createdOn
        • Config.DocumentMetadata.lastUpdated
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to create
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.

      • update

        void update(Context context,
            Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
     throws IOException
        Called to update an existing document on the remote.

        If the remote doesnt support native markdown, the metadata should contain link to converted html file in Context.convertedPaths by the time this method is called. The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.lastUpdated
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to update
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.

      • delete

        void delete(Context context,
            Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
     throws IOException
        Called to delete an existing document on the remote.

        The implementation is responsible for updating the metadata with:

        • Config.DocumentMetadata.deletedOn
        • any remote specific metadata in Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - Errors with local files or any requests made to the remote.
